intro: Tofieldia ulleungensis, commonly known as the Ulleung Island sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Korean island of Ulleungdo. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
